newsitem.title: TAIWAN: Taiwan's Formosa turns sand into gold -- president.
newsitem.headline: Taiwan's Formosa turns sand into gold -- president.

text.p: Taiwan's industrial conglomerate Formosa Plastics Group has "turned sand into gold" in a poor local county by building a multibillion-dollar petrochemical complex, President Lee Teng-hui was quoted as saying.

Lee said during a visit to the US$9 billion complex on Saturday that Formosa's effort had created prosperity and "turned sand into gold" in the poor Yunlin county in southern Taiwan, the United Daily News newspaper reported on Sunday.
Construction of the complex, including Taiwan's sixth, and the first private, naphtha cracker and an oil refinery, started in 1993 and is expected to finish in six years.

Taiwan has been encouraging its businessmen to increase investments at home over fears that its economy might become too dependent on China, the island's political rival since a civil war split them in 1949.
Under government pressure, Formosa in August withdrew its application to build a US$3 billion power plant in China, after it withdrew a US$6 billion petrochemical project in China in 1992.
